tool.name: Roary
tool.description: the pangenome pipeline - Quickly generate a core gene alignment from gff3 files
tool.command:
#for $gff in $gff_input.gffs cp $gff "${gff.element_identifier}.gff" && #end for
#set $filenames = list() #for $gff in $gff_input.gffs #set $filename = str($gff.element_identifier) + ".gff" $filenames.append(str($filename)) #end for
roary -f out -p \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-1} -e -n -i '$percent_ident' -cd '$core_diff' -g '$advanced.maxclust' $advanced.split_para -t '$advanced.trans_tab' -iv '$advanced.mcl'
#for $f in $filenames "$f" #end for

param.name: gff_input_selector
param.label: Individual gff files or a dataset collection
param.help: Select between individual gff files or a collection of gff files

param.name: gffs
param.label: select gff inputs to Roary
param.help: Select the files you wish to send to Roary, must be in gff3 format with the sequence data at the end of the file.

param.name: gffs
param.label: Dataset collection to submit to Roary
param.help: A dataset list collection of gff3 files to send to Roary for analysis.

param.name: percent_ident
param.label: minimum percentage identity for blastp
param.help: Sets the minimum percentage identity for protein matches

param.name: core_diff
param.label: percentage of isolates a gene must be in to be core
param.help: The total percentage of the isolates that must have the gene for it to be considered a core gene.

param.name: outputs
param.label: Additional outputs
param.help: Summary statistics, core gene alignments and Gene Presence/Absence tables are always produced.
param.option: Accessory binary genes in newick format
Accessory binary genes in fasta format
Accessory header file in embl format
Accessory gene table in tabular format
Core Accessory Graph in dot format
Core Accessory table in embl format
Core Accessory table in tabular format
Gene Presence Absence file in Rtab format
Number of Conserved Genes in Rtab format
Number of Genes in Pan Genome in Rtab format
Number of New Genes in Rtab format
Number of Unique Genes in Rtab format

param.name: maxclust
param.label: Maximum number of clusters
param.help: The maximum number of clusters to assign proteins

param.name: split_para
param.label: Don't split paralogs
param.help: Click yes so that paralogs aren't split.

param.name: trans_tab
param.label: Translation table to use [1 or 4 or 11]
param.help: DNA -> RNA translation table to use. Roary is designed for prokaryotes and so tables 1, 4 or 11 will work, others could be problematic.

param.name: mcl
param.label: MCL inflation value
param.help: This is an advanced setting, change only if you know what you are doing and then at your own risk!

data.name: num_pangene_rtab
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string} Number of Genes in Pan Geneome

tool.help:
**Roary**
Roary is a high speed stand alone pan genome pipeline, which takes annotated assemblies in GFF3 format (produced by Prokka) and calculates the pan genome. Using a standard desktop PC, it can analyse datasets with thousands of samples, something which is computationally infeasible with existing methods, without compromising the quality of the results. 128 samples can be analysed in under 1 hour using 1 GB of RAM and a single processor. To perform this analysis using existing methods would take weeks and hundreds of GB of RAM.
To use Roary, select two or more gff3 files OR a collection of gff3 files
**Options**:
- Minimum percentage identity for blastp - an integer, default is [95]
- Percentage of isolates a gene must be in to be core - a float, default is [99.0]
**Advanced Options**:
- Maximum number of clusters - integer, default is [50000]
- Don't split paralogs - check box
- Translation table - which translation table to use, an integer, default is [11]
- Change the MCL inflation value - a float, default is [1.5]
For further info see: http://sanger-pathogens.github.io/Roary/
